name: View Compliance Record Detail
description: Back Office Users can access detailed compliance records with complete requirement statuses and contractor information

background.text: I am logged in as admin

scenarios.name: Successfully navigate to compliance record detail page

steps.text: I am on the compliance dashboard
there are compliance records in the list view
I click the View button for a compliance record
I should be navigated to the Compliance Record Detail page
the page header should display "Compliance Record Detail"
the page should display in read only mode

scenarios.name: Display contractor information correctly in header section

steps.text: I am on a compliance record detail page
the contractor name should be displayed as "First Name Last Name"
the overall compliance status should be displayed with appropriate color badge
all auto-populated fields from Focus should be visible
the contractor ID should be displayed
the email ID should be displayed

scenarios.name: Overall compliance status shows green badge when all requirements are compliant

steps.text: I am viewing a compliance record where all requirements are compliant
the overall status should display "Compliant" with a green badge
all individual requirement statuses should show green badges

scenarios.name: Overall compliance status shows red badge when any requirement is non-compliant

steps.text: I am viewing a compliance record where at least one requirement is non-compliant
the overall status should display "Non-Compliant" with a red badge
the non-compliant requirements should show red badges
the compliant requirements should show green badges

scenarios.name: Requirements section displays all requirements with correct status badges

steps.text: I am on a compliance record detail page
the Requirements section should have "Requirement" column header left aligned
the Requirements section should have "Status" column header right aligned
all 31 insurance requirements should be displayed as rows
each requirement should show appropriate compliance status badge
all requirement fields should be read-only

scenarios.name: Back navigation button returns to compliance dashboard

steps.text: I am on a compliance record detail page
I click the back navigation button
I should be returned to the compliance dashboard list view
the compliance records list should be displayed

scenarios.name: Specific insurance requirements are properly displayed

steps.text: I am viewing a compliance record detail page
the VIN Listed requirement should be displayed with status badge
the Hired requirement should be displayed with status badge
the Combined Single Limit requirements should be displayed with status badges
the Worker's Compensation coverage requirement should be displayed with status badge
the ACORD 25 Version requirement should be displayed with status badge

scenarios.name: Error handling when compliance record data is missing

steps.text: I attempt to view a compliance record with missing data
I click the View button for the incomplete record
I should see an appropriate error message
the page should handle missing fields gracefully

scenarios.name: View button is not accessible for invalid compliance record

steps.text: I am on the compliance dashboard
I attempt to access a non-existent compliance record detail
I should see an error message indicating the record was not found
I should remain on the dashboard or be redirected appropriately

scenarios.name: Page maintains read-only state for all fields

steps.text: I am on a compliance record detail page
I attempt to modify any displayed field
all fields should remain read-only
no edit functionality should be available
the data should remain unchanged

scenarios.name: Requirements display validation with various status combinations

steps.text: I am viewing a compliance record with <scenario> requirements
the overall status should show <overall_status>
the status badge should be <badge_color>

scenarios.name: Display handles maximum number of requirements correctly

steps.text: I am viewing a compliance record with all 31 requirements populated
all requirements should be displayed without truncation
the page should render all requirement rows properly
scroll functionality should work correctly if needed
I am viewing a compliance record with COI attachments
the COI attachments should be displayed in read-only format
attachment information should be visible but not editable

scenarios.name: Alternative navigation using browser back button

steps.text: I am on a compliance record detail page
I use the browser back button
I should be returned to the previous page
the application state should be maintained correctly

scenarios.name: Page refresh maintains compliance record display

steps.text: I am viewing a compliance record detail page
I refresh the page
the same compliance record details should be displayed
all requirement statuses should remain unchanged
the page should maintain read-only mode

gherkin_content:
Feature: View Compliance Record Detail
  Back Office Users can access detailed compliance records with complete requirement statuses and contractor information

  Background:
    Given I am on the application
    And I am logged in as admin

  @smoke @positive
  Scenario: Successfully navigate to compliance record detail page
    Given I am on the compliance dashboard
    And there are compliance records in the list view
    When I click the View button for a compliance record
    Then I should be navigated to the Compliance Record Detail page
    And the page header should display "Compliance Record Detail"
    And the page should display in read only mode

  @positive @data-display
  Scenario: Display contractor information correctly in header section
    Given I am on a compliance record detail page
    Then the contractor name should be displayed as "First Name Last Name"
    And the overall compliance status should be displayed with appropriate color badge
    And all auto-populated fields from Focus should be visible
    And the contractor ID should be displayed
    And the email ID should be displayed

  @positive @status-calculation
  Scenario: Overall compliance status shows green badge when all requirements are compliant
    Given I am viewing a compliance record where all requirements are compliant
    Then the overall status should display "Compliant" with a green badge
    And all individual requirement statuses should show green badges

  @positive @status-calculation
  Scenario: Overall compliance status shows red badge when any requirement is non-compliant
    Given I am viewing a compliance record where at least one requirement is non-compliant
    Then the overall status should display "Non-Compliant" with a red badge
    And the non-compliant requirements should show red badges
    And the compliant requirements should show green badges

  @positive @requirements-display
  Scenario: Requirements section displays all requirements with correct status badges
    Given I am on a compliance record detail page
    Then the Requirements section should have "Requirement" column header left aligned
    And the Requirements section should have "Status" column header right aligned
    And all 31 insurance requirements should be displayed as rows
    And each requirement should show appropriate compliance status badge
    And all requirement fields should be read-only

  @positive @navigation
  Scenario: Back navigation button returns to compliance dashboard
    Given I am on a compliance record detail page
    When I click the back navigation button
    Then I should be returned to the compliance dashboard list view
    And the compliance records list should be displayed

  @positive @detailed-requirements
  Scenario: Specific insurance requirements are properly displayed
    Given I am viewing a compliance record detail page
    Then the VIN Listed requirement should be displayed with status badge
    And the Hired requirement should be displayed with status badge
    And the Combined Single Limit requirements should be displayed with status badges
    And the Worker's Compensation coverage requirement should be displayed with status badge
    And the ACORD 25 Version requirement should be displayed with status badge

  @negative @error-handling
  Scenario: Error handling when compliance record data is missing
    Given I attempt to view a compliance record with missing data
    When I click the View button for the incomplete record
    Then I should see an appropriate error message
    And the page should handle missing fields gracefully

  @negative @access-control
  Scenario: View button is not accessible for invalid compliance record
    Given I am on the compliance dashboard
    When I attempt to access a non-existent compliance record detail
    Then I should see an error message indicating the record was not found
    And I should remain on the dashboard or be redirected appropriately

  @negative @data-integrity
  Scenario: Page maintains read-only state for all fields
    Given I am on a compliance record detail page
    When I attempt to modify any displayed field
    Then all fields should remain read-only
    And no edit functionality should be available
    And the data should remain unchanged

  @edge-case @status-validation
  Scenario: Requirements display validation with various status combinations
    Given I am viewing a compliance record with <scenario> requirements
    Then the overall status should show <overall_status>
    And the status badge should be <badge_color>

  @edge-case @boundary
  Scenario: Display handles maximum number of requirements correctly
    Given I am viewing a compliance record with all 31 requirements populated
    Then all requirements should be displayed without truncation
    And the page should render all requirement rows properly
    And scroll functionality should work correctly if needed

  @edge-case @attachments
  Scenario: Attachment display for COI documents
    Given I am viewing a compliance record with COI attachments
    Then the COI attachments should be displayed in read-only format
    And attachment information should be visible but not editable

  @alternative-flow @navigation
  Scenario: Alternative navigation using browser back button
    Given I am on a compliance record detail page
    When I use the browser back button
    Then I should be returned to the previous page
    And the application state should be maintained correctly

  @alternative-flow @data-persistence
  Scenario: Page refresh maintains compliance record display
    Given I am viewing a compliance record detail page
    When I refresh the page
    Then the same compliance record details should be displayed
    And all requirement statuses should remain unchanged
    And the page should maintain read-only mode
